Reviews.Title: “Thankyou”
Reviews.Author: vanessa052
Reviews.Content: I personally have no faults of the hotel. I just needed a good hotel for 2 nights while in Singapore. Hotel staff very friendly and helpful. I would like to say a special thankyou to Ibraham who was very helpful in sorting out my luggage so I wouldn't have to pay excess baggage like I did from my flight from Perth to Singapore. The nice hotel staff made up for this dated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Against all expectations, highly disatisfied”
Reviews.Author: ktulu
Reviews.Content: I was there for work in February and was expecting a good night sleep in a standard 4 star hotel. Arriving really late, i had no opportunity to change my reservations in case of, and since this was listed with a East Hotel group, I tought i would be alright without checking the place. Well, i should have. This pace was a real dump. Badly organised, with a surge of 3 check-in and all wheels were spinning without traction. I had to take a smoking room, as none other were available. The staff was nice but blasé, and the general impression was the place was dirty. It unfortunately got massively confirmed when i entered the room. The smell of mould from the bathroom was perceptible, even with the Aircon working at the entrance. The bathroom was really neglected and between pubic hair or dust, i found a crust of mould on the window and the wall! Enough to cover all the edges of the windows ledge. The bed was very hard and uncomfortable, and the TV was from the 90's. No channels, menu or instructions even. It felt like a student room from a cheap university. The carpet was new in the hallway and the floor i was at, but the carpet inside my room was from the late 90's. I went for Breakfast in the morning and experienced a relative average service, with this feeling of having some form of service. I guess, rather than infrasturcture, it is always easier to throw legions of cheap staff to give you an average service, than fixing the problems at the core. I checked out and ran away for meetings, wondering why so many people were gathered in the lobby. Than i saw the tour guide and realised why it was on the cheap side. A famous english tour operator (this one being the indian franchise) was obvisouly feeding the hotel with loads of tourists on the cheap angle. I won't go back there, unless i am stuck again and can't find a room in town. It hopefully will go better for them, as i am afraid they will close if it carries on like that.

Reviews.Title: “Had low expectations and these were not even met!”
Reviews.Author: farmerbels
Reviews.Content: Has recently rebranded itself as East Village Hotel however there have been no renovations to the hotel itself. I was booked in here for a business trip as the Mecure was unavailable and it was the only other hotel situated near my work. I did read the reviews so had low expectations of this hotel. I'm a down to earth person (still got my farm girl roots firmly at heart) and isn't hard to please me but just nothing went right with this stay. Their Amex was broken (had been for some time), the lift was broken (one was working), the key cards didn't work with the door (took two trips back downstairs to sort it), the bathroom was filthy with pubic hairs abound, one of the two 'usable' plugs was hanging down by it's wires, no mini bar, no manuals with hotel facilities - explaining emergency procedures, dining options, room service etc. No iron or ironing board. A tv out of the 90's which had a grainy and unclear picture on the one english show (although there was a CNN & sports channel), and the internet plug I eventually found when I pulled out the luggage rack and found it under the fallen tea bags hidden by the carpet. I did go to check out the pool (access via the "cafe!!" with filthy floors) but was smothered in blue smoke from the construction next door so went back inside pretty promptly. The hotel was fairly empty apart from a bus load of partying Mainlanders who had fun and smoked in the corridors until all hours. All in all a pretty miserable experience and I decided to forgo my free breakfast to check out as early as possible and grab a coffee across the road at Starbucks!!! The one positive was that the staff were sweet and I felt bad being grumpy when they are not to blame! My work did not pay a cheap rate for this hotel - and I certainly will not be back under any circumstances!!

Reviews.Title: “Paramount to not a lot at all!!”
Reviews.Author: Jellybean7788
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Paramount this January 2012 en-route to Sulawesi. The best thing about the hotel is the reception area, it all went downhill from there. The room was a good size but needed refurbished as did the bathroom. Although the hotel advertises a shuttle service to Changi Airport it wasn't available for our early check-out at 7.00 am and this was the main reason I had chosen to stay at this hotel!!! I discovered the next day that I had left my sunglasses in our hotel room and sent an e-mail to the hotel asking if they had been found as I could pick them up on our way back through Singapore. As of 7th Feb I still havn't had a reply - customer satisfaction obviously not high on the list of what the owners deem important. Wouldn't recommend this hotel - go and stay somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “Old but great value”
Reviews.Author: Hwei_Fern
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks old on the outside but the furniture and fixtures were well looked after. I booked the hotel through Agoda.com and received a 50% discount on price. Additionally, the staff on duty was kind enough to upgrade my deluxe room to a suite - which is a great bonus for me. The suite room comes with a very nifty master control panel which has buttons to control all the electronic equipment in the suite. I find that rather cool :) However, there is a construction site beside the building which is quite noisy during the day. The hotel is also very near to the red light district, but it is also near to Singapore's food heaven. Overall, I find the hotel okay but with the discount and the upgrade, it provides great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Towards the Average end of Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Uncle_Martin
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel very good is the staff. They were friendly and helpful. This is an overpriced hotel if one pays the advertised rate ... but given that Singapore is an expensive city when one pays the rate charged on the hotel special deals for booking sites the level of expence drops to a normal price for this sort of hotel. Sadly the helpful staff apologised for the over the top price for internet access. Given some of the other reviews, yes the rooms were a tad tired, but being British I am used to this sort of tiredness in hotels which have been partially updated. The TV options were poor quality dross in both mechanical quality and content. The swimming pool was small but clean. There are two excellent shopping centres nearby should you need anything. The pick up joint did not seem to be operating or was not at all intrusive when I stopped there. Yes the quality of the staff is higher than the physical facilities, but this hotel is not the near disaster some other reviews suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Dated hotel in modern Singapore”
Reviews.Author: pedigreebull
Reviews.Content: Stayed just the 1 night but made enough observations that this hotel is in need of a thorough update. There were 3 elevators but only 2 were working. Buttons in the elevators were cracking. We needed to push the security card into the reader real slow before the elevator is able to recognize the card. Elevators are small and if there are tour groups, you can end up waiting quite a bit for the elevators. We got a room on the 12F, a non-smoking floor. However, it smelled bad upon entering the room. Not sure which is worse - a foul smelling room or a smoking room. However, on the plus side, the room was not too bad i.e. rather spacious, relatively comfortable and surroundings were not noisy. However, bathroom had no ventilation so it fogged up real quick. Other items in the room were dated e.g. buttons for the air-conditioning, the music and the lights. The area around the hotel was also dodgy. The hotel is has an adjoining shopping mall that comprises mostly drinking holes but I do not mean your respectable pubs. You cannot see what is going on from the outside of these drinking hotels and there are men standing by the doors - usually a sign that other than alcohol, there are other types of activities going on. Hard to explain if you have family or kids in tow. If you are driving, do be very careful coming down the steep driveway. The end of the steep slope that joins the carpark can damage your car if you are not careful. Having said the above, I will give it points for location (it is about 10 to 15 mins from the airport), and worth considering if you need a reasonably priced hotel but do not need to be in the city. There are many good local eateries around the hotel and a good shopping mall across the road. If you need a place to sleep for a night or two, and are travelling as a single or couple, it is an acceptable place but only because of the reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “a regular hotel with a pick up joint in the basement”
Reviews.Author: Zeeshan S
Reviews.Content: its the fairly average hotel with quite old rooms and a very small lift. the nice part is that you can also have your breakfast by the poolside, the general manager was quite helpful & they also have a tv screen that shows flight timings. the beach is a 10 min walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: app_82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a part of our package tour in November 2011. We were staying in this hotel for 3 days. The hotel is quite old from the outside as well as inside. They really need refurbishing. Room was specious but it was twin sharing where I was expecting it to be double bed.TV remote was not working I had to call the staff and they had to change it. Cable TV was not clear. Toilet flush had got major problems. Entry Key-Cards had problems too. Positive things: Nice and Spacious lobby. Good Breakfast Good view from the room (There was some construction work going on next to hotel building but we were staying only at night so could not hear any noise.)

Reviews.Title: “3rd and final stay”
Reviews.Author: Dave_in_Barrie_11
Reviews.Content: From amenities and almost all of the staff at this hotel way outclass the rooms in this hotel 10 fold. On previous visits I was staying in a room facing the East Coast Park and although the room there was not elaborate and quite frankly outdated and run down, I got everything I needed for a reasonable price. On this stay I was moved to another side of the hotel and put up with noise from construction of a building next door. They don’t need to insulate the buildings in Singapore because of the warm weather. The noise was intolerable from 8 am to 7 pm. This prompted me to look around at the rest of the very outdated room and realize that I will not return to this place on my next visit. If you’ve already booked and are reading this be sure they put you in a room facing the water while at least until the construction is complete.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Karthik R
Reviews.Content: Positives: Though the building is a bit old, the staff have done an excellent job in keeping the hotel clean and attractive. I stayed there for 19 nights and found the stay to be enjoyable. Clean room and surroundings, good food, good location, I would rate it 8 out of 10. The staff are very co-operative and are ever willing to help you out. Though high priced, Paramount met all my expectations. There are some minor points like the TVs which are quite old, but not big issues at all. Negatives: For the money they charge (approx 175SGD + taxes), they can provide free WiFi or breakfast. 15 SGD for that breakfast is a bit overpriced for the food being supplied. TV itself seemed very old. But don't have much to complain apart from the crappy live bands / sick bar girls in the basement forcing and dragging people to drink with them. The basement resembles a Red Light Area. To avoid this, don't use the rear entrance of the hotel.. When provided a feedback to the hotel manager regarding the same, he quickly replied that he had informed the police about it. This is a good news by itself. I would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone travelling without family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and very good value”
Reviews.Author: slipathetongue
Reviews.Content: The Paramount is a nice hotel. Our room was clean and comfortable. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. It was my 1st time in Singapore so I can't compare it to anything else. However, my research, and from what I hear from others, for the price we paid it was a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “OK for overnight or in transit, a tired hotel though.”
Reviews.Author: nzbear
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times on an SIA Stopover deal (even then, "deal" is a bit of stretch!). Have not had bad experiences, and have always found the staff helpful. On my last visit it took 3 attempts to get the room of my choice, but the staff were patient and helpful. Yes it's a bit old and kind of in the middle of nowhere, although there is a big modern mall opposite. Useful if you're in transit between flights. With easy bus travel in Singapore, it's not too much hassle to get places if you need to. Singapore hotel prices are just ridiculous these days, so this is worth considering if you don't might something in need of a bit of upgrading. Rooms are spacious and it's a quiet area. There's much better available if you're prepared to pay big money though.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Hotel, friendly staff, good food”
Reviews.Author: ad_dayz
Reviews.Content: As usual the SQ 517 flight from CCU was just on time. We reached the hotel at 0800 and got an early checkin. Very good hotel, the staff was friendly. Buffet breakfast was good. Had lunch and dinner there too. Food was good and service was prompt.Hotel is conveniently located. Room service was helpful. Would like to go back.

Reviews.Title: “close to pretty much everything in singapore”
Reviews.Author: Shehwaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel as part of a 1 day stopover in singapore. Just hearing the name made me hope for the worst. But it was a pleasant surprise. The lobby is very inviting and the entire staff is very courteous. The rooms are very well appointed and have a great view from the balcony. The entry to all the floors is through individual cards only and restricts entry to each floors. the food is not all that great but there a lot of nice streetside restaurants close to the hotel. Internet is chargeable at 5 dollars per hour. All in all a good place to stay as it is very close to all the main attractions and transport facilities are close by.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and interesting venue”
Reviews.Author: bowerhawk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it is situated in a different area of Singapore. It is quiet, and well back from the road. Our room was the most spacious we have ever had in Singapore and the bed was both comfortable and enormous. Maybe the hotel is a bit old fashioned and in need of an update but the service was excellent. The area offers the chance to see the more traditional houses of Singapore, to explore the beach and to get away from the bustle of the centre. Also, just across the road, there is a huge shopping mall which can compete with the ones downtown, with places to eat out if you find the hotel menu doesn't appeal. However, the hotel does provide regular transport into the town centre if wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay..”
Reviews.Author: Milky99
Reviews.Content: Well, when viewed from outside, it is not a grand hotel and somewhat a bit old style. From the entrance, taxi driver will complain of why not installing auto sensor device. However, the entrance give me somewhat a 70s style...I like it very much. According to the taxi driver, previously, it was facing sea shore but due to land reclamation, there is no longer a seaview. At the lobby, it was not grand at all, but neat and tidy. The counter was small but greeted by friendly staff. The lift was old but fitted with card verification for occupant uses only. The room was spacious, neat, clean and it was seems newly furnished. If not, it was well maintained. Bathroom was clean and comfortable, LCD TV and the bed was I like most...very comfy. The breakfast was a bit disappointing..quite plain with few choices. However, I did not bother to eat much there. At night, just behind the hotel, surprisingly, there was a stretch of pubs located. It was really quite and peace at the hotel but once you pushed the back door, you have entered a total opposite environment...loud music, a lot of girls (mostly Phillipines, Indon, Vietnamese...call girls) standing outside the pubs. When a Westerner past by, they all were jumping and shouting like monkeys in heat. When an Asian walked by, their eyes not even notice him. It was very fasinating, interesting and get real. There was no interesting places nearby the hotel except a shopping mall. It was far from city centre too. Well, went for business trip and quite a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “The food was pathetic and room freezing cold!”
Reviews.Author: Ajess
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in the family room and every morning the breakfast was the same, except for the type of fried noodle on that day. The choice was extremely poor for the price charged. The room was also very very cold. Even when I switched off the air-cond in the room, seemed to have no effect.

Reviews.Title: “bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: rugby064
Reviews.Content: Noisy air conditionned aggressive hookers below the hotel very very bad quality of breakfast I had never seen such a bad quality for a hotel that is considered as ****

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: MukulJoshi
Reviews.Content: really good one. includes all facilities with day and night tours. i ve been staying in this hotel since 2005, during my short trips to singapore.

Reviews.Title: “OK but recommend avoid if family stay”
Reviews.Author: DarrenDA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is best if you are on a stop over stay in Singapore for a night or 2. Access to taxis are easy but there is no near access to the MRT/trains. It is located in Katong area and the back of the hotel is walking distance to a lot of shops offering many types of good food. Also walking distance to a large shopping centre. Hotel has an outdoor pool. Only drawback about this place is at night , there are hordes of bar girls / loud music at the pubs located downstairs from the hotel, which makes it a uncomfortable for females staying here. Best to avoid if travelling with family/children.

Reviews.Title: “Below average hotel”
Reviews.Author: aoh101
Reviews.Content: I only stayed here one night for the transit through Singapore. However, I was less impressed by the service and poor maintenance of the room. I maybe harsh because I once stayed in Mercure, which is just around the corner from Paramount hotel, and I got a much better service. Shower didn't work well. Internet was not free. Bed was uncomfortable. There's no free shuttle bus to airport unlike Mercure. So I had to organise a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for an overnight between Europe and Australia/New Zealand”
Reviews.Author: TWMC2010
Reviews.Content: We booked a single night in the Paramount between Sydney and London using the Singapore airlines stopover holiday at the special rate of $2 so from my point of view it was great value. The staff were very helpful as you would expect in Singapore but unfortunately in our case a little too helpful, we had just got a taxi to the hotel rather than wait for the inclusive stop over bus as we had less than 8 hours to get some sleep between flights but they insisted on booking us a place on the bus to take us back to the airport in the morning before letting us have the room key despite my insistence that we were happy to just get a taxi in the morning and really just wanted to get some sleep. The room was large but rather dated and the beds were a bit hard but everything was clean and given the price it was much better than sleeping at the airport. I can't comment on the food as we left (by taxi) before the restaurant opened in the morning. The hotel is only 5 minutes from the airport which makes it quite a distance from the lights of the city centre but there was a bus stop outside and public transport in Singapore is pretty good. If you want to get some sleep between flights and you can get a good rate this hotel is well worth considering but if you are going to spend more time in Singapore head for somewhere in the centre like their sister hotel the Peninsula Excelsior which is normally the same rate via Singapore Airlines.

Reviews.Title: “A $1.00 a minute - I still can't believe it!!!”
Reviews.Author: johndfffff
Reviews.Content: Internet service charged at a $1.00 a minute (Singapore dollar = .71 US), NO MAX. The staff was nice and actually embarrassed to tell me the internet charge. I have no problem with making a profit, but this, in my opinion, is equal to robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Good Security Staff”
Reviews.Author: omega_aqua
Reviews.Content: So far for this year, I had stayed twice at this hotel and I kept forgetting to write a review for this hotel..Hence, this time since its gonna be a while that I will come back to Singapore, I must make sure this review is up here. My first stay here was during the Apec Summit held at Singapore. Since hotels everywhere was booked, i stayed at Paramount Hotel, which was actually a place that is convenient for me as it was near to a shopping centre...if i'm not wrong, the name of the place is Parkway...Well, I would comment that on average the hotel was quite acceptable for the price, service was good but both my stay, I was very impressed by one staff there whom I kept bumping to.. During my 1st stay there, when i arrived at the hotel, there was a tour group at the lobby and the bell boys are are already busy with the luggages with the tour group, I was struggling with my luggages. However, 1 staff, came up to me and helped me out with my luggage. I was very relieved. I do thought he was the bell boys too. After my breezy check in, i went to him to thank him, only to find out he was the security personnel with the hotel. That i think was just very good initiative! In addition, for my stay there, I could say that this person was very dilligent in doing his job as a security personnel. Pardon me for saying, I had stayed at 5 to 6 stars hotels in singapore, but none security personnel i've seen had been staying vigilant enough to handle the security of the hotel. I mean, after several hotel bomb attacks, shouldn't the security of the hotel been more vigilant??This security personnel in this hotel, I've seen him patrolling the hotel, a complex connecting to the hotel and putting in initiative in doing more than what his job demands. My second trip was during the Singapore Airshow. Again I met this personnel, he greeted me, but i think he could not remember me. His work performance was still the same.I did not get his name but he is a young tall man,in black coat, working in the security team. I must say, the management had done a good job in training his staff and made my stay a comfortable and safe one. You can call me paranoid, but to me, even if your hotel is top of the notch, but if security is handled lowly, foreigners like us will always have to keep a guard to ourselves...To the management of this hotel, thank you for your service to me and congratulate your staff on my behalf. Will make your hotel as my accomodation for my future visit to Singapore for Sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Find elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: DandAtas
Reviews.Content: My Partner and I stayed here in late Feb, 2010. It was pretty horrible- Very old and overpriced. It reminded me of some sort of bad movie - club lounges, a radio built into the bed, old TV, doors to balcony didnt open. Bed was big and reasonably clean but i felt like it made me really itchy. Bathroom was not very clean. Service was fair but not very friendly or welcoming. Not a great start to the holiday. On the way back through Singapore we stayed at Hotel Madras which was half the price and much nicer and better location to shops, train station and only marginally more in a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Best Avoided”
Reviews.Author: Parky14
Reviews.Content: Our holiday consisted of 2 nights in Singapore and then onto Thailand. When Singapore airlines cancelled our flight home, they offered us two nights hotel accommodation in Singapore until the next flight home, which we accepted. The hotel is not in a good location; it is half way between the airport and the city centre. There is no MRT within walking distance and the taxi prices vary between £6 and £9 (one way into the centre) dependant on the driver. We then sussed out how to use the buses - there is a stop right outside the hotel and they are really easy to use. The bus stop shows where the buses go to and each stop has a stage number. When you get on the bus, pick up a leaftet which tells you the number of every stop. There is a machine on the bus which tells you the number of each stop when you get to it, so you know which number stop to get off at. The buses are very cheap and air-conditioned. The hotel itself is very old-fashioned. When we arrived late at night we were told we had been upgraded to an executive room. The room was very large, but all the furnishings were totally worn out - the chair was literally thread-bare and the room stank of smoke. (We are non-smokers and we were not asked if we wanted smoking or non-smoking). We would have asked to move rooms, if it weren't so late in the night. We went out looking for somewhere to eat, but due to time everywhere seemed shut (we did go out the wrong way, which we found out later!) so we decided to go back and order room service. The food was absolutely disgusting and we should really have refused to pay for it and complained, but again, as it was so late we just wanted to go to sleep. The hotel's location is pretty weird. If you venture out of the hotel you end up in a kind of shopping centre precinct, which is full of blacked-out bars. On the second day of our trip, we checked out of our room, but was only being picked up for the airport later, so we put some clothes in our bags to change into. When we got back to the hotel and asked the concierge where the hotel toilets were to get changed, we were informed they were throught the door into the precinct. This was approx 7pm in the evening. You had to pay the woman outside to use the toilets. All the bars are blasting out music and the toilets, which were like un-maintained public toilets were full of scantily-clad women who were using the bars. There was no loo roll and the floors were wet. This was where I had to get changed for the airport. I cannot comment on what happens in the bars, but I did feel that there was a very seedy atmosphere. We couldn't complain, as we had got the accommodation for free, but if you are in the same position and are offered this hotel, I would ask if you could pay towards upgrading to a better hotel in a nicer location.

Reviews.Title: “outdated & remote”
Reviews.Author: Roachnkane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked by travel agent for us and it was not quite what we were expecting. It was located half way between airport and city which meant it was miles from anything. The decor was very outdated and the bed was like sleeping on rocks.

Reviews.Title: “A place for Bachelors”
Reviews.Author: VJ26
Reviews.Content: I had stayed there for 5 nights and the Hotel rooms are good. However the complimentary breakfast is not good and they do not have choices. With the available food, it tastes bad. This Hotel is 15-20min. drive from teh Airport & is costs around S$150-180, but it worth a stay. This Hotel has mini bars on their other side, but not run by the Hotel Management and could be a lot entertaining for bachelors who wish to find a partner...

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: HappyWandererHouston
Reviews.Content: Sure my company booked me here (cost cutting I think) but it is nowhere near as bad as the reviews made out. I was on the 7th Floor so had no problem with noise but i thought the area was quiet, even with Katong Village out the back. Perhaps this 7th floor has been redecorated because it seemed perfectly fine decor and clean to me. I heard rumours about the working girls in the bars nearby but you have to go right around the back of the hotel to access these (no, I did not go! :-) ) and all the lifts have new key card entry so there was no unwanted persons on your floors. I think an unstated plus about the Paramount is it is pretty central to the airport and to the town. A taxi to the quays or Orchard Road is only S$15 max and you have great shopping Mall (Parkway parade) opposite. And for those of you with an ounce of get up and go you are 5-7 minutes walk to East Coast park (go through the mall and take the underpass behind - perfectly safe in Singapore) and you have a long coast of activity, beach (albeit narrow), roller blading, a surfing lake (puled by those automatic rope thingies) and a great pint at Scruffy Murphys pub, together with a Fish food restaurant complex and cheaper hawker stalls a little farther up. Hasn't got the attraction of a lovely city hotel but hasn't got the huge pricing either. I would not say i would recommend it but would not balk at going back but I also would not book it for alonger stay, maybe 3-5 days max and use it as a cheap hub.

Reviews.Title: “Awful ...really is..”
Reviews.Author: JasShanghai
Reviews.Content: My clients, who will remain anonymous, always books me into this hotel as considered cheap so I have stayed 4 times. The hotel is awful rooms are dirty and smell unbearable. In 2007 room I had there were 100's of small bugs crawling over the wall behind the bed so had to move bed away. The bathrooms are in awful state. The breakfast is really a joke, you best save your money and eat out many nice food places about round in that area. For the money (I paid around £80/night) you could stay off Orchard Road as I have a number of times before and hotels are cleaner and up to date. I was told in 2007 this place was going to be knocked down so was disappointed to find myself booked back in for 2008 (' ';) so I hope the bulldozer gets to it before I do for 2009. Staffs are pleasant enough but just staying in bad hotel spoils the beauty of Singapore so be warned. Downstairs is the sleazy side of Singapore numerous bars and scantly clad females wondering about. If you decide to pop across the road and down Joo Chiat Road you can get more than just an eye full there's hundreds of them. The girls do not approach you or give you hassle so isn't bad as other countries where young ladies make a living off the streets. It’s safe and in a way amusing but is not place for families. If you plan trip for around mid September to come in line with Ramadan, there is many stalls selling allsorts at night and is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Trapped in a time warp”
Reviews.Author: NigelSki
Reviews.Content: The hotel was built in the 1970s and is trapped in a time warp. The reception and some areas have seen refurbishment but too much of the hotel is dated and tired. Arrival is strange as the car park has a barrier to keep shoppers out of the site. Staff were polite and helpful and the place was clean but the rooms were tatty and very dated. On the plus side they offered us complementary breakfasts (buffet style) but our evening meal was bizarre as we sat alone in a dining hall for 200 with 4 staff hovering. Food was a grade above school meals but for the price it was as expected. Compared with the normal run of hotels in Singapore this is one of the poorer ones!

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Wattamillsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is between the city and the airport and we were given the room because we had to transit overnight. Although the hotel appeared a bit run down from outside it was pleasant and quiet (we were upgraded to the 7th floor away from the lifts). The staff were pleasant and the Kapong district had many cheap eateries.

Reviews.Title: “24 hr checkin”
Reviews.Author: BarrynSue
Reviews.Content: It was a reasonably priced hotel and therefore chosen as my overnight stay before heading back to the airport. The accommodation was clean but I agree with June 2007, the furnishings were a little tired, but then I wasn't paying top price either. I didn't see any of the other reviewers prostitutes or nightclubs, but then I didn't leave the room. The room had a very slight musty smell, but that seems to be a problem in most 3 star hotels in humid countries. Perhaps they could install an airfreshener device.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the hookers - not a family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blowie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is due to be knocked down in a couple of months - its cheap and OK to stay in, but the "nightclubs" downstairs are what draw most male visitors. Phillipino and Vietnamese prostitutes at least 300 strong fill these clubs and entertain guests who venture there back at their rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Completely satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: JBCTexas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have spent 8 to 10 nights here in late May to early June for the last 3 years and will be returning next week. We have found the staff to be outstanding, the food good and the room nice. The furnishings are a little worn but everything in our room was comfortable. We asked for the door to our balcony to be unlocked and it was done so immediately. We did not have any problem with the noise. The bars in the old shopping area on the ground floor are seedy but did not cause us any concern. There is a little quick stop grocery, etc store in the hotel where the owner and his family are great. We only ate our breakfasts at the hotel but found the food and the service to be quite good. The large shopping center across the street and down 1 block was nice and has several American fast food places as well as local cuisine, nice stores and fair prices. We like the place.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable, - but location far out”
Reviews.Author: PolarbearDK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 11 consecutive nights as part of a business trip. Usually I stay in town, but for some reason it was not possible to get rooms. An agent booked the room for me. The hotel is quite OK allthough on the average side, and rooms appear a bit worn down. I had a room at the end of the corridor and did not experience any noise from elevators, but in the mornings when I worked in room quite a lot of chit-chat from staff who had their breaks just outside my door. The amenities in room are sufficient, as well as bathroom functions are OK, - but appear very old and in need of upgrade. Beds are quite hard, but still you get a good sleep in absolutely clean and spotless sheets. The room had a fridge of mini-bar type but with no drinks. Acceptable for me as there is plenty shopping nearby to get cheaper drinks than a minibar normally offers. Below the hotel there is a shopping arcade, or used to be, as now converted to a "bar street" open from 5pm to 1am. Generally this is no disturbance to the hotel, but if you pass as a male to get to the street late afternoon or at night, you have to pass a minefield of loose girls trying to shanghai you into the bars. Some night you could hear a bit of music from these bars, as my room was in that end of hotel, but just after midnight all quiet. In general I felt the hotel to be good value for money as I had a corporate rate from my agent, but counting 2 return trips a day to town by taxi, the cost will match a much better hotel in town. I used the busses frequently as at least two routes serves Chinatown where I like to eat, shop, etc. Internet in room was superb, but expensive compared to room rate. The hotel has several restaurants and conference facilities. I only had the buffet breakfast some days, and it was OK, - no more. Coffee tends to be topped up with hot water as time passes, - quite good if you come early but very thin just before closing time. I would not stay in this hotel again unless difficult to book in town, - due to the location rather than the hotel standard which generally is OK.

HotelInfo.Name: Paramount Hotel Singapore
HotelInfo.Address: 25 Marine Parade Road, Singapore 449536, Singapore
